remarks: Equivalent of Axiom of Choice.  This is useful for proving that there exists, for example, a sequence mapping natural numbers to members of a larger set ` B ` , where ` ph ` depends on ` x ` (the natural number) and ` y ` (to specify a member of ` B ` ).  A stronger version of this theorem, ~ ac6s , allows ` B ` to be a proper class.  (Contributed by NM, 18-Oct-1999.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 27-Aug-2015.)
statement:
ac6.1 $e |- A e. _V $.
ac6.2 $e |- B e. _V $.
ac6.3 $e |- ( y = ( f ` x ) -> ( ph <-> ps ) ) $.
ac6 $p |- ( A. x e. A E. y e. B ph -> E. f ( f : A --> B /\ A. x e. A ps ) ) $.
$d A f x $.
$d B f x y $.
$d f ph $.
$d ps y $.
